abstractText: Knowledge of what fish eat, when they eat and where they eat is an essential component of fisheries management and research (Garvey and Chipps 2012). Several methods exist for obtaining diet data from various fish species; however, sacrificing individual fish and removing the stomachs to later analyze gut contents is often the most error-free and unbiased method for assessing fish diets (Garvey and Chipps 2012).
title: Lethal collection of fish stomachs v1.0
